alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 9:40AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jefferson, north central Madison, southwestern Lowndes, southeastern Thomas and southern Brooks Counties through 1030 AM EDT... At 940 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boston, or 7 miles west of Quitman, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Quitman, Valdosta, Boston, I-75 At Exit 16, Dixie, Dills, Grooverville, Cherry Lake, Everett, Hamburg, Pinetta, Valdosta Regional Airport, Kinderlou, Pidcock, Lovett, Nankin, Empress, Clyattville, Brooks Co A/p and Blue Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
